snippet: U.S. Open champion Angelique Kerber officially became the oldest woman to debut at No. 1 in the WTA rankings, ending Serena Williams' record-tying run of 186 consecutive weeks in the top spot....
lead_paragraph: U.S. Open champion Angelique Kerber officially became the oldest woman to debut at No. 1 in the WTA rankings, ending Serena Williams' record-tying run of 186 consecutive weeks in the top spot.

headline.print_headline: US Open Champ Kerber Replaces Williams at No. 1 in Rankings
headline.main: US Open Champ Kerber Replaces Williams at No. 1 in Rankings
